Installation¶

There are two ways to install pyrtools: via the pip package management system, or directly from source. Note that we only support Linux and macOS; we’ve had issues compiling the C code on Windows. If you know how to fix this, please open up a Pull Request (Information for developers)

Recommended¶

In a shell, please run:

pip install pyrtools

From source¶

Obtain the latest version of Kymatio:

git clone https://github.com/LabForComputationalVision/pyrtools

Finally, the package is installed by running:

cd pyrtools
python setup.py -e .

This will install an editable version of the package, so changes made to the files within the pyrtools directory will be reflected in the version of pyrtools you use.
